intro: Ceropegia caespitosa subsp. vestita, commonly known as the woolly milkweed, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features a creeping, stoloniferous growth habit with dense clusters of fleshy, greenish-blue leaves covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
